intro: Cyphostemma barbosae, commonly known as the African moonvine, is a climbing plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and distinctive, palmately lobed leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in clusters, followed by orange-red, fleshy fruits. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Cyphostemma barbosae is well adapted to arid environments and can thrive in full sun.
